answers.answer: "Weakness or partial paralysis/stroke-like symptoms"Weakness left arm."Sudden jerking of fingers or entire limbs"fingers and left arm rarely

HiThanks for writing to the forum!I am sorry to see you suffering so much and equally sorry to say that the symptoms have a very varied presentation. In the present scenario let your diabetes specialist rule out peripheral neuropathies due to diabetes. Also you should test for MS, Lyme’s, BIH or benign intracranial hypertension, compression of nerves high up in cervical spine, Vit D deficiency, Vit B12 deficiency, electrolyte imbalance and hypothyroidism of autoimmune origin like Hashimotos.Hope this helps. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!
No help at all from family doctor wont do blood test wants me to keep waiting when it it is getting worse.  Going to have to go to several doctors.

question: Okay I've had some of these symptoms all my life but have gotten worse  and some are new.Symptoms include but are not limited to:Stiffness of joints, back, neck  (rarely)Muscle pain or crampsBurning or stabbing sensations in the bodypressure in the headWeakness or partial paralysis/stroke-like symptomsLightheadedness, woozinessSudden jerking of fingers or entire limbsUnexplained weight gain, lossUnexplained fevers (high or low grade)Continual infections (sinus, kidney, eye, etc.)Symptoms seem to change, come and goIncreased floating spotsOver sensitivity to lightFlashing lightsRinging in one or both earsHeart palpitations or extra beatsMood swings, irritability, rageMemory loss (short or long term)Confusion, difficulty in thinking, brain fogUnexplained hair lossHeadaches, mild or severeTwitching of facial or other musclesUnexplained menstrual pain, irregularitySore throat, hoarsenessanemiaOveremotional reactions, crying easily Too much sleep, or insomniaShortness of breath, coughI have type 2 diabetes, PCOS , allergies and hypertension.  Some of the symptoms started when a doctor switched me back and forth from different antibiotics for a month or so.  I've had my thyroid test before and what they tested for was fine.What should I have my doctor test me for?
title: Lyme, MS or what?
